validations.message: The slug cannot begin or end with a slash.

contentTypes.name: Conference Speaker
contentTypes.description: (v2) Represents a speaker with associated bio & head shot for a conference

contentTypes.name: Config
contentTypes.description: A simple model that allows us to dynamically change simple variables across the whole application.

validations.message: We only allow the default site config for this site
Please enter a valid email. Example: info@theporch.live

contentTypes.name: Dropdown Menu
contentTypes.description: (v2) A Dropdown Menu can be attached to a main menu to show additional menu items on click.

contentTypes.name: Dynamic Button
contentTypes.description: (v2) A MenuButton which calculates its URL on the fly.  Several options are provided for which URL to use.

validations.message: A Menu Button should have a very short text field - ideally a single word.  Please limit the text to 60 characters.
The icon name must be one of the icons in Google's Material Design library: https://material.io/tools/icons/

contentTypes.name: Flexible Email Signup Form
contentTypes.description: (v2) A fully-flexible form for an arbitrary number of inputs, which map to Mail Merge tags inside mailchimp.  Only use this if you know what a mail merge tag does.

contentTypes.name: Form Field
contentTypes.description: (v2) A single input field inside a form

contentTypes.name: Hotel Info
contentTypes.description: (v2) Info about a hotel in the area, plus booking link.  For use with Section: Hotels

validations.message: The URL must be a slug with a leading slash, like '/ft-worth'

contentTypes.name: Menu
contentTypes.description: (v2) A Menu contains a number of Menu Buttons or other Menus, which will be rendered as drop-downs.

validations.message: The items must be either buttons or drop-down menus.

contentTypes.name: Menu Button
contentTypes.description: (v2) A Menu Button is a clickable button that goes on a Menu.  It has a link to a Page or a URL.

validations.message: A Menu Button should have a very short text field - ideally a single word.  Please limit the text to 60 characters.
The icon name must be one of the icons in Google's Material Design library: https://material.io/tools/icons/
The external link must be a URL like 'https://www.watermark.org/', a mailto url like 'mailto:info@watermark.org', or a relative URL like '#location-on-page'
The Page Link must be a link to a Page which has a slug.

contentTypes.name: Migration History
contentTypes.description: System Type - Do Not Modify

contentTypes.name: Page V2
contentTypes.description: All new pages should use this type

validations.message: The slug must look like the path part of a URL and begin with a forward slash, example: '/my-page-slug'

contentTypes.name: Price Option
contentTypes.description: (v2) An option for a price to be displayed by the Pricing Section

validations.message: The time of day must be something like "7:00 AM" or "12:15 pm"
The slug can only contain lower case letters, numbers, underscores and dashes.

contentTypes.name: Schedule Item
contentTypes.description: A list item that is attached to a Section: Event Schedule

contentTypes.name: Section: Conference Speakers
contentTypes.description: (v2) A section with speaker bios for a conference page

contentTypes.name: Section: Email List Signup
contentTypes.description: (v2) A form that users can enter their email to subscribe to a mailing list

contentTypes.name: Section: Event Schedule
contentTypes.description: v2 Event Schedule section displaying events with extra info

contentTypes.name: Section: FAQ
contentTypes.description: (v2) A section containing a number of expandable frequently asked questions

contentTypes.name: Section: Hotels
contentTypes.description: (v2) A section with a list of Hotels for a conference attendee to look at

contentTypes.name: Section: Pricing
contentTypes.description: (v2) A section displaying price information chosen from a set of options based on some criteria

contentTypes.name: Section: Social Follow
contentTypes.description: (v2) A short content section with social media links prompting the user to follow us on social media

contentTypes.name: Section: Video About
contentTypes.description: v2 About section with youtube video

contentTypes.name: Simple Mailchimp Form
contentTypes.description: (v2) A Form containing only First Name, Last Name, and Email form fields.  For more complex forms use the full Mailchimp Form content type.

validations.message: Please enter a Youtube URL. Example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bCMXgxtpLV8

settings.helpText: This is what shows up on the Google search results page
If present, this replaces the menu in the site footer.  If left un-set, the Top Navigation is used to generate the footer.
If you don't set a menu label, this is the text that will appear on the button that opens the dropdown menu.  If you do set a menu label, that will control the text.
As an alternative to the Media icon, you can select an icon from here: https://material.io/tools/icons/
Choose one of the URLs that we know how to calculate
The "id" or "key" which is used to identify this field in the resulting list.  Example: 'FNAME'
This appears next to the input field as a title for the field.
This appears inside the input box when the user has not entered any input yet.
This is the value that will be submitted if the user has not entered anything.
Set to "yes" to require the user to provide a value for this field.
Set this to "yes" if the hotel has been sold out.  The booking button will be disabled.
Provide a URL to something on another website, a `mailto:` link to an email address, or a deep link into an app.
If provided, this will link the user to the specific section on a page.  You must use this in combination with Page Link.
As an alternative to the Media icon, you can select an icon from here: https://material.io/tools/icons/
This is what shows up on the Google search results page
The Float Menu appears to the right side of the page and stays there as the user scrolls.
If this menu is provided, it replaces the Top Navigation on mobile.  It goes inside the Hamburger.
This is what shows up on the Google search results page
This shows up in place of the "Short Date Text" field if present.
Use a table here to create an hourly schedule.
If not provided, the background will be the default gradient.
